summary: This bill, the Yuhaaviatam of San Manuel Nation Land Exchange Act, proposes a land exchange between the United States and the Yuhaaviatam of San Manuel Nation. The Secretary of Agriculture, through the Forest Service, would exchange approximately 1,475 acres of National Forest System land for approximately 1,460 acres of land owned by the Nation in San Bernardino County, California. The bill defines the land parcels, specifies survey requirements, and mandates an agreement to preserve the historical and cultural integrity of the Arrowhead landmark site. Land acquired by the Secretary will become part of the San Bernardino National Forest.
